comments.author: The Cozy Herbivore
comments.content:
Caramelized white chocolate? I am intrigued! And you're right, butterscotch is hot right now-- I myself prefer it made with a splash of single malt. Not just because I love scotch (which of course I do!) but because I think the peaty smokiness really adds a depth of flavor to the butterscotch.

But of course I think you did the right thing by omitting it for a school fundraiser. :)

comments.author: Katherine Martinelli
comments.content: I think the first time I ever had a butterscotch pudding was the butterscotch budino at Mozza and it was love at first bite. I've never had caramelized white chocolate but am completely intrigued.

comments.author: Brian Preble
comments.content: Funny how times change. The "oh no, not again" dessert from my high school days is now a fashion statement?  In any case, I love butterscotch pudding (just not the cafeteria sort), and this sounds delicious.

comments.author: Liss
comments.content: This sounds delicious! I am so glad I found your blog. Can't wait to try this!

comments.author: Vegan
comments.content: Do you have an opinion on freezing extra ganache fillings?  Would it be useable?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Yes, my memory is that frozen ganache will work well, just thaw it gently to minimize weeping.

comments.author: Ruth Martin
comments.content:
This sounds absolutely delish! I'd likely think it too good to be true...
I am not a gourmet cook my any means, but I do like to think of myself as a bit of a foodie. (meaning I appreciate good food!) I need to make what my family will eat though, and that happens to be down home Mennonite/Amish style cooking :)
